alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 1:43PM EST until January 11 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Griffin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way upstream from the bridge will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 13.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.5 feet on 02/07/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM EST.
